info.author: Kosta Gaitanis, Elliot Cohen
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
OpenBayes is a library that allows users to easily create a bayesian network and perform inference on it.
It is mainly inspired from the Bayes Net Toolbox (BNT) which is available for MatLAB, 
but uses python as a base language which provides many benefits : fast execution, portability 
and ease to use and maintain. Any inference engine can be implemented by inheriting a base
class. In the same way, new distributions can be added to the package by simply defining the 
data contained in the distribution and some basic probabilistic operations. 

The project is mature enough to be used for static bayesian networks and we are currently 
developping the dynamical aspect.
info.name: OpenBayes
info.summary: An OpenSource Python implementation of bayesian networks inspired by BNT.
info.html_description:
OpenBayes is a library that allows users to easily create a bayesian network and perform inference on it. It is mainly inspired from the Bayes Net Toolbox (BNT) which is available for MatLAB, but uses python as a base language which provides many benefits : fast execution, portability and ease to use and maintain. Any inference engine can be implemented by inheriting a base class. In the same way, new distributions can be added to the package by simply defining the data contained in the distribution and some basic probabilistic operations.

The project is mature enough to be used for static bayesian networks and we are currently developping the dynamical aspect.
